Vita &slong;ci Sancti Bartholomei
SEint Bartelmev þe holie man &punctelev; cam of kingue&slong; blode
Sw&ydot;þe fair man and noble he was &punctelev; and glad & of swete mode
he He &slong;iwede o&rrot;e louerd on eo&rrot;þe here &punctelev; are he deide on þe rode
And i&slong;aiȝ is p&rrot;iuetez &punctelev; with þe oþere ApO&slong;tle&slong; Apostles guode
Þo o&rrot;e louerd was to heouene iwent &punctelev; he p&rrot;echede of him wel fa&slong;te
And wende wide in mani a lond &punctelev; þe ȝw&ydot;le is lijf ila&slong;te
So þat to þe londe of . Inde &punctelev; he cam þo&rrot;uȝ godes Godes wille
At þe onende of þe lond &punctelev; he bilefde wel &slong;tille
A&slong;e an vncouth pilegrim &punctelev; he ȝeode up and doun
he He ne &slong;eide neiþer on ne oþur &punctelev; bote biheold þane toun
In þe temple wa&slong; a fal&slong; god &punctelev; a maumet luþur inovȝ
Þareinne was þe feond of helle &punctelev; and muche folk to him d&rrot;ovȝ
¶
hu&ydot; Huy cleopeden þat Maumet A&slong;taroth &punctelev; þat þo&rrot;uȝ þe deoue&slong;es miȝte
Ofte he wolde An&slong;werie answerie men &punctelev; and nanie he binam heom heo&rrot;e &slong;iȝte
heo&rrot;e Heore &slong;peche and heo&rrot;e lime&slong; al&slong;o &punctelev; and duden men wo inovȝ
& ȝwane he aȝen ani &slong;ick man cam &punctelev; of his vuele he withd&rrot;ouȝ
Þanne wa&slong; þe sike man hol anon &punctelev; a&slong;e he mo&slong;te nede amende
Ȝwane he ne hadde non oþur vuel &punctelev; bote a&slong;e þe &slong;ch&rrot;ewe him &slong;ende
And he withd&rrot;ovȝ him of is vuel &punctelev; he mo&slong;te nede hol beo
Þe sch&rrot;ewe tolde þe men þanne &punctelev; þat þis wonder miȝten iseo
Þat he hadde þo&rrot;uȝ is miȝte &punctelev; þe men imaud hol inovȝ
And þei þe sch&rrot;ewe ne dude non oþur guod &punctelev; bote of is vuele him withd&rrot;ouȝ
Þarefo&rrot;e &slong;ike men al dai &punctelev; ful þicke aboute him &slong;ouȝte
And criden on him wel deolfulliche &punctelev; þat he to hele heom b&rrot;ouȝte
¶Of þingue þat was al&slong;o fo&rrot;to come &punctelev; men axeden him feo&rrot; and neo&rrot;
And he heom tolde of alle þing &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ þe deouele&slong; pouwer
Folk cam þicke abouten him &punctelev; bi daiȝe and bi niȝte
And he an&slong;uerede heom of al þat hu&ydot; wolden &punctelev; muche is þe deouele&slong; miȝte
Ake after þat seint Seint
Bartelmev &punctelev; to þulke cite com
Þe power of þat fal&slong;e god &punctelev; clanliche he binom:
Fo&rrot; he ne miȝte aftur þulke t&ydot;me &punctelev; with no man &slong;peke riȝt nouȝt
Ne ȝiuen An&slong;uere ansuere of noþing &punctelev; so he was bineoþe ib&rrot;ouȝt
Þat folk cam þicke aboute him &punctelev; to witen at him heo&rrot;e wille
Of þingue&slong; a&slong;e hu&ydot; weren bifo&rrot;e iwoned &punctelev; and euere he was pu&ydot;&rrot; &slong;tille
Þarefo&rrot;e wa&slong; wonder inovȝ &punctelev; deol and &slong;o&rrot; also
hu&ydot; Huy weren aferd to beon fo&rrot;lo&rrot;e &punctelev; and þat hu&ydot; hadden ouȝt misdo
to To atoun hu&ydot; wenden þarebi&slong;ide &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ heo&rrot;e alre wit
to To an oþur Maumet þat wa&slong; his felawe &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; cleopeden berit Berit
hu&ydot; Huy crieden on him wel deolfulliche &punctelev; þat he heom tolde fo&rrot;e
Ȝwi A&slong;taroth heo&rrot;e owene god &punctelev; his &slong;peche hadde fo&rrot;lo&rrot;e
Ȝe ȝe &slong;eide þis luþere be&slong;t &punctelev; ȝe ne witen nouȝt hou it is
With &slong;trongue chaine&slong; al fu&ydot;&rrot;ie &punctelev; he i&slong; ibounde iwi&slong;
Fo&rrot; Bartelmev
gode&slong; Godes &slong;eriaunt &punctelev; þat is þudere icome
And in þe cite geth wel &slong;tilledeliche &punctelev; and is power him hath binome
And ibounde him so fa&slong;te þat he ne ma&ydot; &punctelev; ene&slong; d&rrot;awe is b&rrot;eth
Ake þo&rrot;uȝ Angui&slong;che anguische is clene ouercome &punctelev; a&slong;e þei he hadde iþoled deth
¶Ȝwat is þilke Bartelmeuȝ &punctelev; þeos oþere him axeden anon
Þat mai makien o&rrot;e almiȝtie god &punctelev; ded &slong;o an&ydot; &slong;ton
he He is &slong;eide þis Maumat &punctelev; of gret pouwer a&slong;e ȝe i&slong;eoth
he He mai do with u&slong; al þat he wole &punctelev; fo&rrot; bineothþe him we beoth
Eche daie an hund&rrot;et &slong;iþe &punctelev; and oþur &slong;wuch bi niȝte
he He knevleth to is god in guode entente &punctelev; þat ȝifth him al is miȝte
Aungle&slong; with him inowe he hath &punctelev; ȝwwareþo&rrot;uȝ þat he ma&ydot; do
Al þat he wole with us alle &punctelev; and alle þing he wot al&slong;o
Fo&rrot; he wot nouþe þare a&slong;e he is &punctelev; al o&rrot;e &slong;peche and o&rrot;e þouȝt
Þarefo&rrot;e ich rede eov alle wel &punctelev; þat ȝe ne w&rrot;athþi him nouȝt
ech Ech manere &slong;peche þat is &punctelev; he knoweth and &slong;peket al&slong;o
bote Bote at one wo&rrot;de alle þing &punctelev; he wot ȝwat is ido
Ȝif ȝe him sechez þei ȝe come &punctelev; riȝt bi him a&slong;e he is
Ȝe ne &slong;chulle him nouȝt iseo &punctelev; bote him&slong;eolf wolle iwis
Ake þu&slong; ȝe him mouwe iknowe &punctelev; ȝif ȝe him iseo
he He is &slong;wiþe long of bodi &punctelev; of riȝt fair fourme and freo
Op&rrot;iȝt he geoth and euene inovȝ &punctelev; and &slong;wiþe ȝwijȝt is his bleo
his His her is b&rrot;oun and &slong;wiþe crips &punctelev; non ne mai crip&slong;o&rrot;e beo
Muchele e&ydot;ȝene and euene no&slong;e &punctelev; i&slong;treiȝt adoun along
his His berd is long and &slong;id inouȝ &punctelev; and &slong;umdel ho&rrot; among
In a ȝwijȝt Golioun golioun he geth &punctelev; he nath cloþe&slong; non mo
Alle þis &slong;ixeandtwenti ȝer &punctelev; þarinne he hath igo
Þat fram him it neuereft ne cam &punctelev; ne hit ne apeirez nouȝt of hewe
Ne fo&rrot;oldeth nouȝt withalle &punctelev; ake is euere iliche newe
Wel he wot al þat ȝe &slong;pekez &punctelev; and ȝwat ȝe doth alle here
Þarefo&rrot;e ȝif he eou axeth ouȝt &punctelev; ȝe ne mowen eou nouȝt &slong;kere
Ake ȝif he him &slong;ewi so &punctelev; þat ȝe him mowe iseo
biddez Biddez him fo&rrot; hi&slong; louerde&slong; loue &punctelev; þat he beo milde to me
Þat he ne come nouȝt here neiȝ me &punctelev; þat ich beo to grounde ib&rrot;ouȝt
And ito&rrot;mented a&slong;e mi felawe is &punctelev; fo&rrot; inelle mi&slong;don him nouȝt
¶Þo þis fole men þis iheo&rrot;den &punctelev; hu&ydot; weren in gret þouȝt
And longue heom þouȝte are hu&ydot; hadden &punctelev;
&slong;eint Seint
Bartelmevȝ i&slong;ouȝt
hu&ydot; Huy wende aȝen to heo&rrot;e owene temple &punctelev; ake hu&ydot; weren alle blinde
twei Twei daiȝe&slong; hu&ydot; &slong;ouȝten him fa&slong;te &punctelev; and ne miȝten him nouȝwere ifinde
A dai a&slong;e al þat folk &punctelev; to þe temple was ib&rrot;ouȝt
f F o&rrot;to honouri heo&rrot;e fal&slong;e god &punctelev; þat ne miȝte heom helpe nouȝt
A gu&ydot;di man þare cam al&slong;o &punctelev; þat þe deuel hadde ibeo longue
In him and binomen him is wit &punctelev; and ito&rrot;mented him ful &slong;trongue
Anon &slong;o þis gidie man &punctelev; into þis temple cam
Þe deuel þat in him was &punctelev; gret deol to him nam
Wel loude he gradde " seint Seint
Bartelmeuȝ &punctelev; ich bi&slong;eche þe
Þine o&rrot;e&slong;one&slong; b&rrot;ennez me al &punctelev; þou haue merci of me
¶Þis holie man &slong;tod þarebiside &punctelev; and an&slong;werede him anon
beo Beo doumb he &slong;eide ich þe rede &punctelev; þat þou out of him gon
Þe deuel fleuȝ anon with þat wo&rrot;d &punctelev; out of him in þulke place
And þe sike man bicam hol and &slong;ound &punctelev; anon þo&rrot;uȝ gode&slong; Godes grace
Þat folk &slong;tod al in gret wonder &punctelev; þo hu&ydot; i&slong;eiȝen þis cas
And biheolden þene holie man &punctelev; þat of swuch power was
And tolden wide þis holie dede &punctelev; þat ne miȝte nouȝt beo ihud
In þu&slong;&slong;e manere seint Seint
Barthelmevȝ &punctelev; wa&slong; fo&rrot;me&slong;t in Inde ikud
Pollimius hiet þe k&ydot;ng &punctelev; þat of þulke contreie was
Sone þe tiþingues to him comen &punctelev; of þat faire cas
he He hadde ane douȝter þat wa&slong; lunat&ydot;ke &punctelev; þat þe deuel hadde muche with to done
And made hire witles euerech monthþe &punctelev; a&slong;e hit feol in þe &slong;tat of þe mone
he He &slong;ente to þis holie man &punctelev; seint Seint
Barthelmevȝ wel sone
Þat he of is douȝter hadde reouþe &punctelev; and hele hire þo&rrot;uȝ is bone
Þudere wende þis holie man &punctelev; and þis ma&ydot;de founde
Bitinde alle þat neiȝ hire come &punctelev; and grenninde fa&slong;te ibounde
Þis holie man &slong;tod and biheold &punctelev; þene deuel he made out wiende
hire Hire riȝte wit heo hadde anon &punctelev; euereft to hire liue&slong; ende
Welle glad wa&slong; hire fader þo &punctelev; and elle&slong; it were with wouȝ
he He liet fette fo&rrot;th riche cloþus &punctelev; and gold and &slong;eluer inouȝ
And liet chargi Camailes camailes þarewith &punctelev; and with riche ȝim&slong;tone&slong; al&slong;o
to To p&rrot;e&slong;enti with þis holie man &punctelev; þat swuch dede hadde ido
Ake þare nas non þat miȝte him finde &punctelev; þo hu&ydot; comen with al þis p&rrot;u&ydot;te
Þarebi he miȝten onder&slong;tonde &punctelev; þat he þarof tolde lu&ydot;te
And þo no man ne miȝte him finde &punctelev; hit ofþouȝte &slong;o&rrot;e þe k&ydot;ngue
Ake nathþele&slong; þis holie man &punctelev; ne fo&rrot;ȝat him of none þingue
Aniȝt a&slong;e he lai in his bed &punctelev; and on him fa&slong;te þouȝte
Þis holie man &slong;tod him bifo&rrot;e &punctelev; he nu&slong;te ho him þudere b&rrot;ouȝte
Sire king he &slong;eide ȝwat was þe &punctelev; to &slong;iende me swuch p&rrot;u&ydot;te
Þov ne paide&slong;t me riȝt nouȝt þarewith &punctelev; fo&rrot; ich tolde þarof lu&ydot;te
Ake þat tre&slong;o&rrot; þat ich of telle &punctelev; þat is heouene riche
Þat ne rou&slong;tez ne apeirez nouȝt &punctelev; ake euere wo&rrot;thþ iliche
And fo&rrot;to techen eov of gode&slong; Godes lawe &punctelev; hidere ich am icome
And makie eov leten eouwer fal&slong;e gode&slong; Godes &punctelev; and lieuen on gode&slong; Godes &slong;one
Fo&rrot;to techen eov þulke lawe &punctelev; hidere ich am ib&rrot;ouȝt
And maken eov leten ouwer fal&slong;e gode&slong; Godes &punctelev; þat ne mouwen eov helpe nouȝt
And ȝif þou nelt nouȝt of þu&slong;&slong;e þingue &punctelev; ilieue þat hit soth beo
Cum with me to ouwer fal&slong;e god &punctelev; and þov &slong;chalt þe soþe iseo
Þe king wende þo fo&rrot;th with him &punctelev; to ho&rrot;e fal&slong;e god anon
heo&rrot;e Heore luþere p&rrot;eo&slong;te&slong; hu&ydot; founden þere &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e him mani on
And duden to him heo&rrot;e &slong;acrefi&slong;e &punctelev; a&slong;e hu&ydot; weren iwoned to done
Þe deuel þat witinne him was &punctelev; wel loude he gradde &slong;one
And &slong;eide ȝe w&rrot;echche&slong; leteth anon &punctelev; and ne Anourieth anourieth me riȝt nouȝt
la&slong;te Laste ȝe beon in &slong;wuch to&rrot;ment &punctelev; a&slong;e ich am inne ib&rrot;ouȝt
Fo&rrot; Ie&slong;u cri&slong;tes Cristes
Aungeles &punctelev; þat þe giwe&slong; to deþe b&rrot;ouȝte
here Here beoth fa&slong;te aboute me &punctelev; and b&rrot;ingueth me alto nouȝte
With b&rrot;enninde raketeiȝes &punctelev; hu&ydot; habbeth me fa&slong;te ibounde
Þo&rrot;uȝ power of heo&rrot;e heiȝe louerd &punctelev; þat þe giwes ȝeuen deþe&slong; wounde
And he þareaftur þane þ&rrot;idde da&ydot; &punctelev; so weilawei þe &slong;tounde
Fram deþe to liue he aros &punctelev; and b&rrot;ouȝte u&slong; alle to grounde
And in eche &slong;ide his apo&slong;tle&slong; &slong;ende &punctelev; to p&rrot;echie gode&slong; Godes name
And on of heom is nouþe here &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ ȝwam ich habbe þis &slong;chame
¶Þat folk &slong;tod and biheold aboute &punctelev; and nu&slong;ten ȝwuch he wa&slong;
Seint Barthelmevȝ &slong;tod and &slong;iȝte &slong;o&rrot;e &punctelev; and ofte &slong;eide alas
And &slong;eide nouþe ȝe mouwen i&slong;eo &punctelev; ȝwuch lijf ȝe ledeth her
And in ȝwuch a god ȝe bilieueth &punctelev; and ȝwuch is his pouwer
Ȝif ȝe wollez þat ich bidde fo&rrot; eov &punctelev; mine louerd þat u&slong; bouȝte
Draweth adoun ouwer Maumat &punctelev; ant tob&rrot;ekez him alto nouȝte
Þo þe king iheo&rrot;de þis &punctelev; his men he hiet echon
Abouten him ca&slong;ten &slong;trongue ropes &punctelev; and d&rrot;awen him adoun anon
Þat folk folk wa&slong; þo redi anon &punctelev; and rope&slong; ca&slong;ten on him inowe
Ake hu&ydot; ne miȝten him nouȝt ene&slong; wawie &punctelev; fo&rrot; al þat hu&ydot; alle d&rrot;owe
Doth awei quath &slong;eint Seint
Barthelmev &punctelev; and ouwer rope&slong; nimez adoun
And þo þe &slong;ch&rrot;ewe onbounde was &punctelev;
seint Seint
Barthelmevȝ &slong;eide is o&rrot;e&slong;oun
Þou deuel he &slong;eide þat ha&slong;t bitraid &punctelev; þu&slong; muche folk echon
Ȝif þou wolt þat Ine make þe nouȝt &punctelev; to þe putte of helle gon
Wiend out anon mid þulke fourme &punctelev; and b&rrot;ec hit alto nouȝte
Þe deuel anon with þulke wo&rrot;de &punctelev; wel narewe is wei he &slong;ouȝte
And tob&rrot;u&ydot;&slong;de al þat w&rrot;echche maumat &punctelev; and wiende þe out þarof anon
And alle þe maumate&slong; of þe temple &punctelev; heo toda&slong;chten euerechon
Al þat folk &slong;tod and þis i&slong;eiȝ &punctelev; and wel loude bigonne to crie
And &slong;eiden þare nis bote on almiȝti god God &punctelev; ibo&rrot;en of þe ma&ydot;de marie Marie
Seint Barthelmeu criede on Iesu cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; and bad is o&rrot;e&slong;oun
An Aungel cam &slong;o b&rrot;iȝt so &slong;onne &punctelev; fram heouene liȝte adoun
to To þe four hu&ydot;rne&slong; he fleuȝ aboute &punctelev; and in euereche he d&rrot;ouȝ
With his finger a wel fair croiz &punctelev; apert and cler inouȝ
Mi louerd he &slong;eide me &slong;ende hidere &punctelev; and a&slong;e he him&slong;eolf me &slong;ede
Þis temple ichulle bifo&rrot;e eou alle &punctelev; clan&slong;i of eche fu&ydot;lþehede
Ake ichulle nouþe fo&rrot;me&slong;t þene deuel &punctelev; to eov alle schewen iwis
Þat ȝe mouwen þe soþe isco &punctelev; ȝwuch ouwer bileue is
Ake þei he beo gri&slong;lich fo&rrot;to biholde &punctelev; ne habbez of him no doute
Ake &slong;wuch &slong;igne a&slong;e ich habbe imaud &punctelev; in þeos four hu&ydot;&rrot;ne&slong; aboute
Makiez þulke &slong;ulue &slong;igne &punctelev; in ouwer fo&rrot;eheued echon
And ech luþur þing euereft &slong;chal &punctelev; fram eou fleon oþur gon
Þo maden hu&ydot; alle in heo&rrot;e fo&rrot;eheued &punctelev; þe fourme of þe rode
And þe Aungel heom &slong;cheuwede al ab&rrot;od &punctelev; þene deuel a&slong;e hu&ydot; &slong;tode
Þe fourme of a gri&slong;lich man &punctelev; þat al fo&rrot;b&rrot;oide were
And swartto&rrot;e þane euere ani blouȝman &punctelev; with foule farinde chere
A &slong;charp face he hadde and al fo&rrot;kroked &punctelev; hi&slong; berd atelich and long
Eiȝene b&rrot;ode al b&rrot;enninde &punctelev; red and swart among
Anon to is fiet tilde is her &punctelev; and after þe sch&rrot;ewe &slong;um it d&rrot;ouȝ
his His hondene bihinden him at his rug &punctelev; hu&ydot; weren þare wel inouȝ
Fu&ydot;&rrot;ie &slong;peldene al &slong;tinkende &punctelev; out of is mouth he bla&slong;te
And fu&ydot;&rrot; of b&rrot;um&slong;ton at his no&slong;e &punctelev; þat &slong;tonk al&slong;o foule and fa&slong;te
Croked wa&slong; boþe no&slong;e and mouth &punctelev; w&rrot;echchede was his bone
And bote it were and hendi bacheler &punctelev; abid fo&rrot;to eftsone
Daiþet habbe &slong;wuch a louerding &punctelev; and alle þat him wel loue
Ȝeot þei þe sch&rrot;ewe gret pouwer habbe &punctelev;
god God is euere aboue
¶Þou luþere þing quath þis Aungel &punctelev; þat here art nouþe onder me
Fo&rrot; þou dude&slong;t Barthelmeu&slong; he&slong;te &punctelev; ichulle habbe reuþe of þe
Ichulle þe onbinde and late þe fleo &punctelev; on eo&rrot;þe in eche ende
Fo&rrot;to þe dai of dame come &punctelev; þat þou to helle iwiende
Þo þis luþere be&slong;t onbounde wa&slong; &punctelev; with wel gri&slong;liche bere
he He fleuȝ awei among heom alle &punctelev; and neuereft ne cam þere
Þo þe Aungel hadde al þis ido &punctelev; to heouene heuene he wende an heiȝ
Ȝeo&rrot;ne criede ech of heom &punctelev; þat al þis wonder i&slong;eiȝ
And hereden god God and þene Aungel also &punctelev; þat þare among heo cam
hu&ydot; Huy crieden euere on &slong;eint Seint
Barthelmev &punctelev; þat he ȝeue heom cri&slong;tindom
So þat al þat ilke lond &punctelev; to cri&slong;tinedom wa&slong; ib&rrot;ouȝt þo
Þo&rrot;uȝ þe Aungele and &slong;eint Seint
barthelmev Barthelmev &punctelev; ible&slong;&slong;ede beon hu&ydot; bo
Pollimius with is Quene &punctelev; alle is child&rrot;ene he nam
And liet

baptizen of seint Seint
barthelmevȝ Barthelmevȝ &punctelev; and &slong;ethþe al is kinedom
So þat al þat ilke lond &punctelev; to cri&slong;tinedom was ib&rrot;ouȝt
Þe king fo&rrot;&slong;ok al is lond &punctelev; and ne tolde þarof riȝt nouȝt
And wende and &slong;iwede seint Seint
Barthelmeuȝ &punctelev; and p&rrot;echede with him wel fa&slong;te
And bicam &slong;wiþe holi man &punctelev; and wa&slong; bi&slong;chop at þe la&slong;te
¶Ane b&rrot;oþer herre k&ydot;ng þane he wa&slong; &punctelev; he hadde of grete p&rrot;u&ydot;te
A&slong;triages wa&slong; is name &punctelev; þarebi&slong;ide a lu&ydot;te
Þe t&ydot;þingue of seint Seint
Barthelmeuȝ &punctelev; wel &slong;one to him cam
Alhou he hadde þene king is b&rrot;oþer &punctelev; iturned to cri&slong;tinedam
A þou&slong;end men wel j Armede armede &punctelev;
After after him he &slong;ende
Fo&rrot;to enqueri into al þat lond &punctelev; ȝwoderward he wende
hu&ydot; Huy wenden and &slong;ouȝten him ful &slong;tu&ydot;&rrot;neliche &punctelev; and þo he wa&slong; ifounde
bifo&rrot;e Bifore heo&rrot;e kingue A&slong;triages &punctelev; hu&ydot; b&rrot;ouȝten him fa&slong;te ibounde
And &slong;wiþe ofte he wa&slong; with heom ipult &punctelev; þat he feol adoun to grounde.[v. 213 al. om.]
¶Bel ami &slong;eide A&slong;triage&slong; þe king &punctelev; hou haue&slong;t þou on itake
ha&slong;t Hast þou mine b&rrot;oþur with tricherie &punctelev; imaked mi gode&slong; fo&rrot;&slong;ake
bi Bi þe fei þat i &slong;chal to mahun &punctelev; ichulle &slong;erui þe also
And make þe bileue þine fal&slong;e god &punctelev; oþur to &slong;trongue deþe þe do
And ȝeot þeof mo&rrot;e &slong;chame opon oþur &punctelev; a&slong;e ich iheo&rrot;e bi manne&slong; &slong;awe
Þov ha&slong;t o&rrot;e gode&slong; elle&slong;ȝware &punctelev; defoulet and altod&rrot;awe
¶Sire king quath &slong;eint Seint
Barthelmeuȝ &punctelev; þou ne &slong;ei&slong;t nouȝt a&slong; þe hiende
Þat i &slong;cholde with tricherie &punctelev; þine b&rrot;oþere&slong; heo&rrot;te wiende
With no tricherie ne wende ich him &punctelev; ake with &slong;othþene&slong;&slong;e and with riȝte
Ich b&rrot;ouȝte him out of mi&slong;bileue &punctelev; to him þat alle miȝte
Fram þe gode&slong; þat beoth al&slong;o miȝtele&slong;e &punctelev; a&slong;e is þat dede treo
Þat ich liet altod&rrot;awe &punctelev; and ȝif þou wolt þe &slong;oþe iseo
bring Bring me to þine oþur god &punctelev; and ȝif ich mai don &slong;wuch dede
Ilief wel þat he is miȝtele&slong; &punctelev; and fo&rrot;&slong;ak þou him ich rede
And with þulke god God þat ich on bilieue &punctelev; ȝif þou miȝt so on take
Ich rede þat þou aco&rrot;di þe &punctelev; and þine owene god fo&rrot;&slong;ake
And ȝif þat ich mai þo&rrot;u &slong;trencþe of mi louerd &punctelev; þinne god ouercome
Fo&rrot;&slong;ak þe w&rrot;echche&slong; a&slong;e hu&ydot; beoth wu&ydot;&rrot;þe &punctelev; fo&rrot; heo&rrot;e miȝte heom is binome
Nadde he bote þis wo&rrot;d i&slong;eid &punctelev; þat þare ne cam to þe kingue
A me&slong;&slong;ager wel ha&slong;teliche &punctelev; þat b&rrot;ouȝte him ful &slong;o&rrot;i tiþingue
Þat berit Berit is owene god &punctelev; þat he wel ofte &slong;ouȝte
Wa&slong; ifalle of þe temple adoun &punctelev; and al toda&slong;cht to nouȝte
¶Þo þe king iheo&rrot;de þis &punctelev; so&rrot;i he wa&slong; inouȝ
he He fierde a&slong;e a man þat witle&slong; were &punctelev; and is cloþe&slong; al tod&rrot;ouȝ
he He liet nime seint Seint
barthelmeu Barthelmeu
&punctelev; and to&rrot;menti him wel fa&slong;te
And with grete &slong;taues legge on him &punctelev; þe ȝw&ydot;le hu&ydot; wolden ila&slong;te
Þo he wa&slong; defoulet so &punctelev; þat reouþe it was to wite
A&slong;e we findez in &slong;ome &slong;tude &punctelev; of his liue iw&rrot;ite
¶
He He liet him don on a rode &punctelev; is heued toward þe grounde
Fiet and hondene to þe treo &punctelev; inailled and fa&slong;te ibounde
And seth to don him mo&rrot;e pine &punctelev; a&slong;e we findez iwite al&slong;o
Þo he hadde þeron ihonged longue &punctelev; he liet him adoun do
And liet hu&ydot;lden is fel al fram is flech&slong; &punctelev; al quik with kene kn&ydot;ue
Riȝt a&slong;e men hu&ydot;ldeth a ded oxe &punctelev; men hulden him aliue
Alas hou miȝten hu&ydot; habben þe heo&rrot;te &punctelev; alas þe deolfulle pine
louerd Louerd muche is þi miȝte &punctelev; a&slong;e þov &slong;cheoude&slong;t þare bi þine hine
At þe la&slong;te þo he wa&slong; ihuld &punctelev; a&slong;e we findez iw&rrot;iten al&slong;o
hu&ydot; Huy &slong;miten of is holie heued &punctelev; are hu&ydot; miȝten him to deþe do
Vnneþe hu&ydot; miȝten mid al þis wo &punctelev; b&rrot;ingue is lijf to fine
Muche wonder was þat ani lijf miȝte &punctelev; on eo&rrot;þe þolie &slong;wuch pine
his His bodi wa&slong; þo&rrot;uȝ cri&slong;tine men &punctelev; ibured faire inouȝ
Wel þicke a&slong;e hu&ydot; do&rrot;&slong;ten &punctelev; þat folk þudereward d&rrot;ouȝ
Fo&rrot; o&rrot;e louerd anonriȝt fo&rrot; is loue &punctelev; fair miracle þare &slong;ende
Ȝwarefo&rrot;e guode men þareaboute &punctelev; wel þicke þudere wende
¶Þe luþere king A&slong;triages &punctelev; þat him liet so aquelle
he He d&rrot;adde him &slong;umdel of þe miracles &punctelev; þo he heo&rrot;de þarof telle
Þane þ&rrot;eotteoþe dai þareafterward &punctelev; þat he liet him martri þere
Alle þe grete mai&slong;tres he nam with him &punctelev; þat of þe temple were
And to is toumbe hu&ydot; wenden alle &punctelev; þare a&slong;e þat holie bodi lai
Anon &slong;o hu&ydot; þudere comen &punctelev; a&slong;e al þat folk i&slong;a&ydot;
Þe deuel þat heo&rrot;e mai&slong;ter wa&slong; &punctelev; to&rrot;mentede heom anon
Fo&rrot; w&rrot;eche of þat holie man &punctelev; hu&ydot; bicomen gu&ydot;die echon
And a&slong;e fo&rrot;lo&rrot;ene w&rrot;echche&slong; hu&ydot; deiden þo &punctelev; he ne liet heom no leng gon
Into helle þe &slong;oulene with him he nam &punctelev; þare ne liet he nouȝt on
¶Þe t&ydot;þingue wa&slong; sone wide ib&rrot;ouȝt. &punctelev; hu&ydot; d&rrot;adden heom wel so&rrot;e
Þat of mi&slong;bileue weren &punctelev; hu&ydot; ne do&rrot;&slong;ten þo nonmo&rrot;e
Ake hu&ydot; fo&rrot;&slong;oken ho&rrot;e fal&slong;e lawe &punctelev; and beden o&rrot;e louerde&slong; o&rrot;e
And lieten heom cri&slong;tni euerechone &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ seint Seint
Barthelmeus lo&rrot;e
POllonius Pollonius þat k&ydot;ng wa&slong; er &punctelev; and þat to o&rrot;e louerde&slong; lawe him nam
bi&slong;chop Bischop hu&ydot; maden him ouer heom alle &punctelev; to holden op cri&slong;tindom
he He wa&slong; bi&slong;chop twenti ȝer &punctelev; are he dude heonne iwiende
to To þe Io&ydot;e ioye of heouene is &slong;oule wende &punctelev; at þe twenti ȝeres ende
Þare wa&slong; of seint Seint
Barthelmeuȝ &punctelev;
Miracles miracles euere inowe
And wel þicke alaboute to is toumbe &punctelev; muche folk euere d&rrot;owe
Ȝeot þare weren luþere men bileued &punctelev; and hadden þato envie
Þat ne biliefden nouȝt þat o&rrot;e louerd was ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; of þe maidene Marie
A vetele&slong; hu&ydot; maden al of led &punctelev; and þareinne hu&ydot; ca&slong;te
Þis holi bodi wel fijlliche &punctelev; and dutten it sw&ydot;þe fa&slong;te
And amidde þe se ca&slong;ten hit &punctelev; and wolden deliueren heom so
Ake ȝeot o&rrot;e louerd cudde is miȝte &punctelev; a&slong;e he hath ofte ido
Fo&rrot; þat ilke led aȝein is ku&ydot;nde &punctelev; þei it vuele were is riȝte
Aboue þe watere it gan to fleote &punctelev; þare was gode&slong; Godes miȝte
Fo&rrot; þat watur nadde power non &punctelev; to holden it to þe grounde
to To þe cite of lupar Lupar it flet &punctelev; and þare it wa&slong; fur&slong;t ifounde
And of cri&slong;tine men op Inome inome
&punctelev; and faire on eo&rrot;þe ib&rrot;ouȝt
Ȝeot o&rrot;e louerd þei he were þare &punctelev; he ne fo&rrot;ȝat him riȝt nouȝt
Fo&rrot; he &slong;ende miracles riuedeliche &punctelev; aboute þe bodie þere
At þe la&slong;te &slong;ome luþere men &punctelev; þat in þe londe were
hadden Hadden þarto ȝeot gret onde &punctelev; and in a t&ydot;me bi&slong;telen þareto
And nomen þe bone&slong; up fram þe &slong;tude &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; weren inne ido
And in þe contreie aboute heom bere &punctelev; and ca&slong;ten euerech in his &slong;ide
Some in one &slong;tude and &slong;ome in oþur &punctelev; and to&slong;p&rrot;adden heom &slong;o wel wide
Fo&rrot; hu&ydot; ne &slong;cholden neuereft togadere come &punctelev; ne mo&rrot;e miracle do
So longue a&slong;e gode&slong; Godes wille wa&slong; &punctelev; defoulede hu&ydot; weren so.
SEint Seint
Barthelmeuȝ cam sethþe &punctelev; to a monek þarebiside
Mine bone&slong; he &slong;eide beoth ica&slong;t &punctelev; and alto&slong;p&rrot;adde wel wide
Inelle nonmo&rrot;e þat hu&ydot; beon so &punctelev; þarefo&rrot;e þou mo&slong;t gon
Þis n&ydot;ȝt aboute þare hu&ydot; beoth &punctelev; and togadere heom b&rrot;ingue echon
A sire merci þi&slong; Monek monek &slong;eide &punctelev; hou &slong;cholde ich iknowe heom nov
Swiþe wel &slong;eide þis holie man &punctelev; and ichulle þe tellen hou
Euerech of heom þare hu&ydot; liggez &punctelev; þei it deo&rrot;k niȝt beo
Sch&ydot;ne &slong;chullen a&slong;e b&rrot;iȝte a&slong;e &slong;onne &punctelev; þat wel feo&rrot; þou &slong;chalt heom iseo
¶Þis Monek monek wende fo&rrot;th bi niȝte &punctelev; he ne fond of heom nouȝt on
Þat hu&ydot; ne schinen a&slong;e clere a&slong;e ani &slong;onne. &punctelev; and &slong;o he gaderede heom echon
In a &slong;chip he b&rrot;ouȝte heom in þe se &punctelev; with gret honour atþenende
Þat ȝwodere&slong;o o&rrot;e louerd wolde &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ is wille heom &slong;ende
A w&ydot;nd þare cam and d&rrot;of þat schip &punctelev; &slong;ofte and euene inouȝ
So þat to þe londe of apu&ydot;le &punctelev; þat schip wel euene d&rrot;ouȝ
Þare weren þe bone&slong; faire onderfongue &punctelev; and faire in sch&rrot;ine ido
Mani fair Miracle miracle þare comen &slong;one &punctelev;
And and ȝeot þare doth also
Bidde we nouþe seint Seint
Barthelmevȝ &punctelev; þat heiȝ Apo&slong;tle is
Þat we moten þo&rrot;uȝ his bone &punctelev; come to heouene blis·
